body:
### Problem

### Describe the bug

Hello,

This is my first issue. I'm experiencing an issue with (i guess) a race condition. Whenever I use 'dd' to destroy a line in my buffer, specifically in a larger PHP file (Symfony 7.4 project, 200+ lines per file), it correctly destroys the line, but TreeSitter takes a hissy fit.

```
Error in decoration provider "line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):                                                                                                                                                                      
Error executing lua: ...nvimnIkFbK/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:195: Index out of bounds                                                                                                                                           
stack traceback:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_get_text'                                                                                                                                                                                                        
        ...nvimnIkFbK/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:195: in function 'get_node_text'                                                                                                                                                
        ...kFbK/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/query.lua:394: in function 'handler'                                                                                                                                                      
        ...kFbK/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/query.lua:884: in function '_match_predicates'                                                                                                                                            
        ...kFbK/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/query.lua:1013: in function 'iter'                                                                                                                                                        
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:385: in function 'fn'                                                                                                                                                           
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:239: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'                                                                                                                                     
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:358: in function 'on_line_impl'                                                                                                                                                 
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:457: in function <...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:451>
```

### Output of `:checkhealth nvim-treesitter`

```markdown
==============================================================================
lspconfig:                                                                  ✅

- `:checkhealth lspconfig` was removed. Use `:checkhealth vim.lsp` instead.

==============================================================================
nvim-treesitter:                                                            ✅

Requirements ~
- ✅ OK Neovim was compiled with tree-sitter runtime ABI version 15 (required >=13).
- ✅ OK tree-sitter-cli 0.26.3 (/home/nikkie/.nvm/versions/node/v23.9.0/bin/tree-sitter)
- ✅ OK tar 1.35.0 (/usr/bin/tar)
- ✅ OK curl 8.5.0 (/usr/bin/curl)
  curl 8.5.0 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/8.5.0 OpenSSL/3.0.13 zlib/1.3 brotli/1.1.0 zstd/1.5.5 libidn2/2.3.7 libpsl/0.21.2 (+libidn2/2.3.7) libssh/0.10.6/openssl/zlib nghttp2/1.59.0 librtmp/2.3 OpenLDAP/2.6.7
  Release-Date: 2023-12-06, security patched: 8.5.0-2ubuntu10.6
  Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ldap ldaps mqtt pop3 pop3s rtmp rtsp scp sftp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp
  Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli GSS-API HSTS HTTP2 HTTPS-proxy IDN IPv6 Kerberos Largefile libz NTLM PSL SPNEGO SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets zstd

OS Info ~
- machine: x86_64
- release: 6.8.0-88-generic
- version: #89-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sat Oct 11 01:02:46 UTC 2025
- sysname: Linux

Install directory for parsers and queries ~
- /home/nikkie/.local/share/nvim/site/
- ✅ OK is writable.
- ✅ OK is in runtimepath.

Installed languages     H L F I J ~
- html                  ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
- html_tags
- php                   ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓
- php_only              ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓

  Legend: H[ighlights], L[ocals], F[olds], I[ndents], In[J]ections ~

==============================================================================
telescope:                                                                1 ⚠️

Checking for required plugins ~
- ✅ OK plenary installed.

Checking external dependencies ~
- ✅ OK rg: found ripgrep 14.1.0
- ⚠️ WARNING fd: not found. Install [sharkdp/fd](https://github.com/sharkdp/fd) for extended capabilities
```

### Output of `nvim --version`

```text
nvim --version
NVIM v0.11.5
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1741730670
```

### Additional context
I run a base nvim, no special flavour. My plugins are managed with Vim Plug. See my init.vim below
```
call plug#begin()

Plug 'nvim-lua/plenary.nvim'
Plug 'nvim-telescope/telescope.nvim'
Plug 'coffebar/neovim-project'
Plug 'Shatur/neovim-session-manager'
Plug 'preservim/nerdtree'

" Themes
Plug 'nickkadutskyi/jb.nvim'

" LSP
Plug 'neovim/nvim-lspconfig'

" Parser
Plug 'nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter'

" UI
Plug 'nvim-tree/nvim-web-devicons'
Plug 'lewis6991/gitsigns.nvim'
Plug 'romgrk/barbar.nvim'
Plug 'akinsho/toggleterm.nvim'

" Autocompletion
Plug 'hrsh7th/nvim-cmp'
Plug 'hrsh7th/cmp-nvim-lsp'
Plug 'hrsh7th/cmp-buffer'
Plug 'hrsh7th/cmp-path'
Plug 'hrsh7th/cmp-cmdline'

" Coding
" Plug 'nvim-mini/mini.pairs'

call plug#end()

color jb
set number
set cursorline
set shiftwidth=4
set tabstop=4
set guifont=Comic\ Mono:h16
let g:did_indent_php = 1
set autoindent
let mapleader = " "

lua << EOF
vim.diagnostic.config({
    virtual_text = true,
    signs = true,
    underline = true,
    update_in_insert = false,
    severity_sort = true,
})

local telescope = require('telescope.builtin')
vim.keymap.set('n', '<leader>ff', telescope.find_files)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<leader>fg', telescope.live_grep)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<leader>fb', telescope.buffers)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<leader>fh', telescope.help_tags)

vim.opt.sessionoptions:append('globals')

require('neovim-project').setup {
    projects = { "~/projects/*" },
    picker = { type = "telescope" }
}

vim.keymap.set('n', '<leader>p', '<cmd>NeovimProjectDiscover<CR>')

-- NERDTree
vim.keymap.set('n', '<leader>tt', '<cmd>NERDTreeToggle<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '<leader>tr', '<cmd>NERDTree<CR>')

-- CMP
local cmp = require('cmp')
cmp.setup({
    mapping = {
        ['<C-space>'] = cmp.mapping.complete(),
        ['<CR>'] = cmp.mapping.confirm({ select = true }),
        ['<Tab>'] = cmp.mapping.select_next_item(),
        ['<S-Tab>'] = cmp.mapping.select_prev_item(),
    },
    sources = {
        { name = 'nvim_lsp' },
        { name = 'buffer' },
        { name = 'path' }
    }
})

-- LSP
vim.lsp.config("intelephense", {
    cmd = { "intelephense", "--stdio" },
    filetypes = { "php", "twig" },
    settings = {
        intelephense = {
            diagnostics = { undefinedFunctions = false },
            files = { maxSize = 5000000 },
            environment = { includePaths = { vim.fn.getcwd() .. "/vendor" }, phpVersion = "8.4.15" },
            stubs = { "Core", "PDO", "Symfony" },
        },
    },
})

vim.lsp.enable("intelephense")

-- Coding pairs
-- require('mini.pairs').setup()

-- Treesitter
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('FileType', {
    pattern = {'html', 'twig', 'css', 'php'},
    callback = function()
        vim.treesitter.start()
    end,
})

require('nvim-treesitter').setup({ pattern = { 'html', 'twig', 'css', 'php' } })

-- UI plugins
require('barbar').setup({
    insert_at_end = true,
    insert_at_start = false,
})

require('toggleterm').setup({
    persist_mode = true,
    direction = 'float',
    float_opts = { border = 'double', title_pos = 'center' }
})

-- General maps
-- Indentation
vim.keymap.set('i', '<S-Tab>', '<C-O><<')

-- Buffers
vim.keymap.set('n', '1', '<Cmd>BufferGoto 1<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '2', '<Cmd>BufferGoto 2<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '3', '<Cmd>BufferGoto 3<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '4', '<Cmd>BufferGoto 4<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '5', '<Cmd>BufferGoto 5<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '<S-A-l>', '<Cmd>BufferMoveNext<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '<S-A-h>', '<Cmd>BufferMovePrevious<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '<A-l>', '<Cmd>BufferNext<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '<A-h>', '<Cmd>BufferPrevious<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('n', '<A-q>', '<Cmd>BufferClose<CR>')

-- Terminal
vim.keymap.set('n', '<A-t>', '<Cmd>ToggleTerm<CR>')
vim.keymap.set('t', '<A-t>', '<Cmd>ToggleTerm<CR>')

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd({"BufEnter", "FileType", "InsertEnter"}, {
    pattern = "php",
    callback = function()
        vim.opt_local.autoindent = true
        vim.opt_local.smartindent = true
    end
})
EOF
```

### Steps to reproduce

1. Install nvim-treesitter
2. run TSInstall php php_only
3. Open a php file with 200+ lines (more than 500 preferably)
4. destroy the current line using 'dd'

### Expected behavior

Well, I'd love to just see my line get deleted and for the process to continue as usual. 


### Nvim version (nvim -v)

0.11.5

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No, VIM 9.1.697

### Operating system/version

Linux Mint 22.1 x86-64

### Terminal name/version

gnome-terminal

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

appimage

comment_data.body:
This is `master` (not `main`) branch, right? I used to have this issue constantly, with many parsers. These issues are fixed per parser. That's why your <https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter/issues/8372> was closed with "Upstream issue".

I think the best bet is to switch to the `main` branch of `nvim-treesitter` (the one that will receive future updates, and which is now the default one); then to make sure you update parsers from time to time (with `:TSUpdate` on startup or manually).

Since (based on previous similar issues) the most likely explanation is that the parser crashes, not that `vim.treesitter` suddenly mishandles ranges, if the issue is persistent, locate who maintains the PHP parser and try there.

Please test the latest development version. The [Releases](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/tag/nightly) page has pre-built archives for Linux/Windows/macOS. Check `:version` to confirm the version.

@justinmk , I've updated to NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1920+g03377b9552 but, unfortunately this has not resolved my issue.
@shushtain I've turned towards the main branch, can PlugClean & PlugInstall. This however did not solve anything, my issue still occurs with large files. It's also not just the PHP parser, it's any file above 300 lines (or like, > 10kb).

@shushtain Thank you kindly for your response. I'm, pretty new to this, I'm pretty sure I copied the global variable from stackoverflow somewhere. I've commented it out and it doesn't seem to make a difference, so I will remove it.

I've made a basic 'clean config', which I will share below. This does not crash. That leaves me to debug line by line (unfortunately) my 'real' config.

```
call plug#begin()
Plug 'nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter', { 'branch': 'main', 'do': ':TSUpdate' }
call plug#end()

lua << EOF
 -- Treesitter
 vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('FileType', {
     pattern = {'html', 'twig', 'css', 'php'},
     callback = function()
         vim.treesitter.start()
     end,
 })

require('nvim-treesitter').setup()
EOF
```

I seem to have made a mistake in saying this failure occurs in every parser. I had some issues with Twig parser that were very much like this one. It seems this is issue is isolated within php&php_only parsers.

To clarify, I meant `vim.opt.sessionoptions:append('globals')`. Some plugins use these to store their state or to check if they are already loaded, so you wouldn't want to store those between sessions. There is, however, nothing wrong with explicit `g:did_indent_php` or `vim.g.mapleader` in an init.vim file, as long as you know what they are for.

Also, you don't need to call `setup()` with `main` branch. I would suggest:

```lua
--
-- ... your existing Plug
--

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("FileType", {
  pattern = { 'html', 'twig', 'css', 'php' },
  callback = function(args)
    local ft = vim.bo[args.buf].filetype
    local lang = vim.treesitter.language.get_lang(ft)

    -- install if not found
    if not vim.treesitter.language.add(lang) then
      require("nvim-treesitter").install(lang)
    end

    -- start if found
    if vim.treesitter.language.add(lang) then
      vim.treesitter.start(args.buf, lang)
    end
  end,
})
```

And then, when you expand the pattern to cover more filetypes, it acts just like `ensure_installed`.
@shushtain thank you for your config. I've realised something else: The specific 'limit' as to when this issue starts occuring seems to be when a file reaches 9400 bytes of data.

@NikkieDev, I'm confused. Let's revisit the claims chronologically:

> specifically in a larger PHP file (Symfony 7.4 project, 200+ lines per file)

> not just the PHP parser, it's any file above 300 lines

> this is issue is isolated within php&php_only parsers

> when a file reaches 9400 bytes of data

All I can say, given this info, is that deleting a line in a quickly generated ~9400-byte PHP file doesn't cause crashes on my side (I've tried simple `echo` lines and deeply nested `'n' =>` structures, just to be sure).

So far you did not make up your mind about which parsers are affected, and what exact minimal config one can use to reproduce it. Those are important, because:

- we can't assume a purely Neovim issue if it breaks only with those extra plugins;
- the problems involving one single parser are usually **within that parser's binary**.

If this does happen with many parsers while all you have is `nvim --clean` + `nvim-treesitter`, please read [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) one more time and prepare a real reproducible example.

Even before that, I would suggest double-checking that your `nvim-treesitter` plugin, `tree-sitter` and `tree-sitter-cli` software, and those specific parsers are all up-to-date. Find how to check their versions and include those, too. If you have switched to `v0.12` after all, do specify that.

Lastly, if the issue is not just with deleting any line in any ts-highlighted file, make the needed actions explicit. If the file is large and complex, link it. Otherwise, something like this could do:

```php
<?php
echo 'debug'; /* repeat 256 times, then do 128Gdd */
?>
```

Sorry to necro-post, but after banging my head against debugging this error for several hours myself trying to build a minimal.lua example config and failing to even get php properly installed with nvim-treesitter for some unknown reason i finaly found what was causing the issue, _at least for me_.

I had https://github.com/nickkadutskyi/jb.nvim installed (but not even active) in my nvim.

 In there, a global treesitter directive is registered with `{ all = true }` that intercepts every treesitter query evaluation.
This triggers a race condition, particularly noticeable in languages with complex grammars like PHP.    

Using a small debug sript I was able to narrow it down to this treesitter parsing situation:
```
Node type: program
Node range: { 0, 0, 972, 0 }     <- The tree thinks the file has 972 lines
Buffer line count: 971            <- The buffer actually has 971 lines
Predicate: { "eq?", 49, "?>" }
```

 When you delete a line with dd, the buffer updates immediately but the tree hasn't reparsed yet.
The jb.nvim directive calls `get_node_text()` on the stale node without checking if it's still valid, causing the "Index out of bounds" error.    

I don't _think_ this is something nvim could/should address as it's on the side of the plugin developers to make sure the nodes that are accessed are still valid before accessing them with `get_node_text()`.       
Plugins should either avoid using global directives with `all = true`, or add safety checks.

I don't know if such a mechanism of asking "hey, is this node still real" already exists, if not, it should probably be created :)


Anyway, see https://github.com/nickkadutskyi/jb.nvim/issues/14 if you are interested in some more details, cheers and good night :D

> Sorry to necro-post, but after banging my head against debugging this error for several hours myself trying to build a minimal.lua example config and failing to even get php properly installed with nvim-treesitter for some unknown reason i finaly found what was causing the issue, _at least for me_.
> 
> I had https://github.com/nickkadutskyi/jb.nvim installed (but not even active) in my nvim.
> 
> In there, a global treesitter directive is registered with `{ all = true }` that intercepts every treesitter query evaluation. This triggers a race condition, particularly noticeable in languages with complex grammars like PHP.
> 
> Using a small debug sript I was able to narrow it down to this treesitter parsing situation:
> 
> ```
> Node type: program
> Node range: { 0, 0, 972, 0 }     <- The tree thinks the file has 972 lines
> Buffer line count: 971            <- The buffer actually has 971 lines
> Predicate: { "eq?", 49, "?>" }
> ```
> 
> When you delete a line with dd, the buffer updates immediately but the tree hasn't reparsed yet. The jb.nvim directive calls `get_node_text()` on the stale node without checking if it's still valid, causing the "Index out of bounds" error.
> 
> I don't _think_ this is something nvim could/should address as it's on the side of the plugin developers to make sure the nodes that are accessed are still valid before accessing them with `get_node_text()`. Plugins should either avoid using global directives with `all = true`, or add safety checks.
> 
> I don't know if such a mechanism of asking "hey, is this node still real" already exists, if not, it should probably be created :)
> 
> Anyway, see [nickkadutskyi/jb.nvim#14](https://github.com/nickkadutskyi/jb.nvim/issues/14) if you are interested in some more details, cheers and good night :D

Excuse my language, but what the flip haha. This seems to have been the issue. I cannot thank you enough.

I am getting the same error in large php files when in my theme https://github.com/nickkadutskyi/jb.nvim if I add these queries into `after/queries/php/highlights.scm`:

```scm
; Temporary fix for PHP closing tag highlighting to support main and master branches
; because master doesn't have php_end_tag
(
  (_) @end_tag
  (#eq? @end_tag "?>")
) @tag

[
  ; (php_end_tag)
  ; Temporary fix for PHP closing tag highlighting to support main and master branches
  ; because master doesn't have php_end_tag
  (_) @end_tag (#eq? @end_tag "?>")
] @template_language
```

Basically my goal is to find ?> and highlight it as @tag

The work around for my case is to do this:
```scm
(text_interpolation
   ((_) @tag @template_language
     (#lua-match? @tag "%?>")
     (#offset! @tag 0 0 0 1)
   ))
```

This doesn't cause the issue in large php files. I guess it limits the search scope and help to avoid the issue?

title: Highlighter taking a hissy fit
